result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:47pm
INCLUDES 15CM445, 15CM540, 15CM541, 15CM1437
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears in person, with Atty Wright Laufenberg

State says hearing today for defenses request on probation conditions
Atty Laufenberg gives history of case and states court allowed no contact provision previously
Atty Laufenberg states deft has been in compliance with probation conditions
Atty Laufenberg is proposing condition of defendant to have contact with his wife completely
State says it is not appropriate for them to take a side on either allowing or not the no contact since the state and court did not order the no contact at the initial appearance
State has not contacted probation agent regarding why this "no contact" was put into place after Thanksgiving 2015
COURT makes findings
COURT grants Atty Laufenberg's request to lift "no contact" between deft and wife with no violent or abusive contact, if probation violation occurs the agent has discrection to impose the no contact condition

Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 18 months probation, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE program and any follow through. Complete AODA assessment and follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge.

Case Called: 10:51am. INCLUCES 15CM445, 15CM540, 15CM541. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Mike Puerner. Defendant appears by Atty Wright Laufenberg.  Atty Wright Laufenberg moves for bond modification re: non waivable no contact with S.W. State objects to modification of non waivable no contact. Arguments by Atty Laufenberg. Victim, S.W. present and makes statement. Further statements by State & Defense.  COURT makes findings. COURT ORDERS: Bond Modification - No violent or abusive contact with S.W.; continue with treatment with VA.  DATES: Set further dates.   Adjourned: 11:06am.
